Documentation.summary: Represents the crawl status of a file.

Field.Name: NotRunning

Documentation.summary: File system crawl is not running.

Field.Display: File system crawl is not running.

Field.Name: InProgress

Documentation.summary: File system crawl is in progress.

Field.Display: File system crawl is in progress.

Field.Name: Completed

Documentation.summary: File system crawl ran to completion.

Field.Display: File system crawl ran to completion.

Field.Name: AllottedTimeElapsed

Documentation.summary: File system was stopped prior to completion because the alotted execution duration had been reached.

Field.Display: File system was stopped prior to completion because the alotted execution duration had been reached.

Field.Name: MaxItemCountReached

Documentation.summary: File system was stopped prior to completion because the maximum number of items had been processed.

Field.Display: File system was stopped prior to completion because the maximum number of items had been processed.

Field.Name: Canceled

Documentation.summary: File system crawl was manually canceled before completion.

Field.Display: File system crawl was manually canceled before completion.

Field.Name: Failed

Documentation.summary: File system crawl was aborted due to an unrecoverable failure.

Field.Display: File system crawl was aborted due to an unrecoverable failure.

Field.Name: Disabled

Documentation.summary: File system crawl configuration is disabled.

Field.Display: File system crawl configuration is disabled.

Documentation.summary: Directory-specific crawl option flags.

Field.Name: None

Documentation.summary: No options selected.

Field.Display: No directory-specific crawl options selected.

Field.Name: SkipSubdirectories

Documentation.summary: Do not crawl nested sub-directories.

Field.Display: Do not crawl nested sub-directories.

Field.Name: Skip

Documentation.summary: Do not crawl the current .

Field.Display: Skip entire directory.

Field.Name: DoNotCompareFiles

Documentation.summary: Do not compare files for redundancies.

Field.Display: Do not compare files contained within in sub-directory for redundancies.

Field.Name: DoNotShow

Documentation.summary: Do not show contents of in public result displays.

Field.Display: Do not show contents of directory in public result displays.

Field.Name: FlaggedForDeletion

Documentation.summary: Mark for deletion.

Field.Display: Indicates that the directory and its contents should be deleted.

Field.Name: FlaggedForRescan

Documentation.summary: Mark for re-scan.

Field.Display: Indicates that the directory and its contents should be re-scanned.

Documentation.summary: Indicates crawl status for the a

Field.Name: Incomplete

Documentation.summary: Not all items in the current have been crawled.

Field.Display: Not all files and nested subdirectories have been crawled.

Field.Name: Complete

Documentation.summary: All items in the current have been crawled.

Field.Display: All files and nested subdirectories have been crawled.

Field.Name: AccessError

Documentation.summary: An error occurred while trying to enumerate items in the current .

Field.Display: An error occurred while trying to enumerate directory items.

Field.Name: Deleted

Documentation.summary: The current has been deleted.

Field.Display: The directory has been deleted.

Documentation.summary: Values for unique application error codes.
Documentation.remarks: The determines the related for the enumerated member. Use to determine the appropriate value.

Field.Name: Unexpected

Documentation.summary: An unexpected error has occurred.

Field.Display: An unexpected error has occurred.

Field.Name: IOError

Documentation.summary: An has occurred.

Field.Display: An I/O error has occurred.

Field.Name: UnauthorizedAccess

Documentation.summary: An has occurred.

Field.Display: Unauthorized Access Error

Field.Name: SecurityException

Documentation.summary: A has occurred.

Field.Display: A security exception has occurred.

Field.Name: InvalidPath

Documentation.summary: The name of one or more files or subdirectories in the path contain a invalid character(s).

Field.Display: A path validation error has occurred.

Field.Name: PathTooLong

Documentation.summary: A has occurred, indicating that hhe specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length.

Field.Display: An excessive path length error has occurred.

Field.Name: CrawlOperationFailed

Documentation.summary: Crawl operation has failed and terminated before completion.

Field.Display: The crawl operation has failed.

Field.Name: DirectoryNotFound

Documentation.summary: A has occurred.

Field.Display: Directory was not found.

Field.Name: GetLogicalDisksFailure
Field.Display: Unexpected error while getting logical disks.

Field.Name: BackgroundJobFaulted
Field.Display: Background job failed.

Documentation.summary: Represents correlation status of a file.

Field.Name: Dissociated

Documentation.summary: File has been added to the database or modified and needs to be analyzed.

Field.Display: File has been added to the database or modified and needs to be analyzed.

Field.Name: PendingValidation

Documentation.summary: Acknowledged; Validation in progress.

Field.Display: Files in the current redundant set have been acknowledged and require validation.

Field.Name: Deferred

Documentation.summary: Final determination deferred.

Field.Display: Determination of files in the current redundant set have been deferred.

Field.Name: Analyzing

Documentation.summary: Correlations to other files are being established.
Documentation.remarks: This status value is only for new files and those which have changed. Results of comparisons will be stored in the table, where the is the new or changed file, and the is the file that it is being compared to.

Field.Display: Correlations to other files are being established.

Field.Name: Correlated

Documentation.summary: File has been compared with all other files with the same Hash. Final disposition pending.

Field.Display: File has been compared with all other files with the same Hash.

Field.Name: Justified

Documentation.summary: File duplicaton is justified.

Field.Display: Files in the current redundant set are justifiably duplicated.

Field.Name: Insupportable

Documentation.summary: Indicates that the files should be deleted.

Field.Display: Files in the current redundant set should be deleted.

Field.Name: Violation

Documentation.summary: Elevated status for unauthorized copies of files that need further attention.

Field.Display: Files in the current redundant set are unauthorized and require further attention.

Field.Name: Attrition

Documentation.summary: Indicates that the file has been scheduled/tasked to be deleted, but not yet confirmed.

Field.Display: Files in the current redundant set have been scheduled/tasked to be deleted, but not yet confirmed.

Field.Name: Deleted

Documentation.summary: The file has been deleted.

Field.Display: File has been deleted.

Documentation.summary: File-specific crawl options.

Field.Name: None

Documentation.summary: No options selected.

Field.Display: No file-specific crawl options are selected.

Field.Name: DoNotCompare

Documentation.summary: Do not compare the current for redundancies.

Field.Display: Do not compare file with others for redundancy.

Field.Name: Ignore

Documentation.summary: Ignore the current .

Field.Display: Ignore the file.

Field.Name: FlaggedForDeletion

Documentation.summary: Mark for deletion.

Field.Display: Indicates that the file should be deleted.

Field.Name: FlaggedForRescan

Documentation.summary: Mark for re-scan.

Field.Display: Indicates that the file should be re-scanned.

Documentation.summary: Represents a host platform type.

Field.Name: Unknown

Documentation.summary: Host platform type is unknown.

Field.Display: Platform type is not known.

Field.Name: Windows

Documentation.summary: Host machine runs on a Windows-based operating system.

Field.Display: Windows-based platform type.

Field.Name: Linux

Documentation.summary: Host machine runs on a Linux-based operating system.

Field.Display: Linux/Unix-based platform type.

Field.Name: OSX

Documentation.summary: Host machine runs on a OSX-based operating system.

Field.Display: OS/X platform type.

Field.Name: Android

Documentation.summary: Host is an android device.

Field.Display: Anroid-based platform type.

Field.Name: IOS

Documentation.summary: Host is an IOS device.

Field.Display: IOS platform type.

Documentation.summary: Represents the priority level of a task.

Field.Name: Deferred

Documentation.summary: Task has been deferred to a later date.

Field.Display: Task has been deferred to a later date.

Field.Name: Critical

Documentation.summary: Task has the highest priority.

Field.Display: Task has business-critical urgency and should take precedence over normal work routine.

Field.Name: High

Documentation.summary: Task has elevated priority.

Field.Display: Task has higher priority and should be addressed before tasks with lesser priority.

Field.Name: Normal

Documentation.summary: Task has normal priority.

Field.Display: Task has normal priority.

Field.Name: Low

Documentation.summary: Task has low priority.

Field.Display: Task has low priority and should be addressed as time/resources permit.

Documentation.summary: Represent the status of a task.

Field.Name: New

Documentation.summary: Task has not been acknowledged.

Field.Display: Task has not been acknowledged.

Field.Name: Open

Documentation.summary: Task has been acknowledged, but not yet started.

Field.Display: Task has been acknowledged, but not yet started.

Field.Name: Active

Documentation.summary: Task is currently being addressed.

Field.Display: Task is currently being addressed.

Field.Name: Pending

Documentation.summary: Task is in a paused state, pending some other factor.

Field.Display: Task is in a paused state, pending some other factor.

Field.Name: Canceled

Documentation.summary: Task has been canceled.

Field.Display: Task has been canceled.

Field.Name: Completed

Documentation.summary: Task has been completed.

Field.Display: Task has been completed.

Documentation.summary: Defines an application user role.

Field.Name: None

Documentation.summary: No application roles/access.

Field.Display: No application access granted.

Field.Name: Reader

Documentation.summary: Read-only application access.

Field.Display: Basic read-only application access.

Field.Name: Auditor

Documentation.summary: Extended read-only application access for auditing purposes.

Field.Display: Extended read-only application access.

Field.Name: Contributor

Documentation.summary: User can read and write file system crawl results for their own shared crawl results as well as read and write task records.

Field.Display: Read / write access to file system crawl results for personal shared crawl results as well as read / write access to task records, including ability to reassign tasks.

Field.Name: ITSupport

Documentation.summary: User can read and write all file system crawl results and task records, including ability to reassign tasks.

Field.Display: Read / write access to all file system crawl results and task records.

Field.Name: ChangeAdministrator

Documentation.summary: User can create new remediation tasks as well as determine desired state of files and directories.
Documentation.remarks: This role implies the privileges of the and roles as well.

Field.Display: Same privileges as IT Support and can also create new remediation tasks as well as determine desired state of files and directories.

Field.Name: AppAdministrator

Documentation.summary: User can make changes to most application settings.
Documentation.remarks: This role implies the privileges of the , and roles as well.

Field.Display: Read / write access to all records as well as the ability to make changes to most application settings.

Field.Name: SystemAdmin

Documentation.summary: User can make changes to all application settings as well as the ability to read and write all records.

Field.Display: Read / write access to all application data and settings.

Documentation.summary: Unique value to represent a specific message code.

list.item: The determines the related for the enumerated member. Use to determine the appropriate value.

Documentation.summary: Indicates the severity of a status message.
Indicates that the associated message is informational.
Indicates that the associated message is a warning.

Represents a volume status.

Field.Name: Unknown

Documentation.summary: The status of the volume is uknown or unspecified.

Field.Display: The status of the volume is uknown or unspecified.

Field.Name: Controlled

Documentation.summary: Volume is under corporate control / ownership.

Field.Display: Volume is under corporate control / ownership.

Field.Name: AccessError

Documentation.summary: An error occurred while trying to access the volume.

Field.Display: An error occurred while trying to access the volume.

Field.Name: Uncontrolled

Documentation.summary: Volume is being tracked, but is not under corporate control / ownership.

Field.Display: Volume is being tracked, but is not under corporate control / ownership.

Field.Name: Offline

Documentation.summary: Volume is offline or unavailable.

Field.Display: Volume is offline or unavailable.

Field.Name: Relinquished

Documentation.summary: Ownership / control of volume has been relinquished to another entity.

Field.Display: Ownership / control of volume has been relinquished to another entity.

Field.Name: Destroyed

Documentation.summary: Volume has been destroyed.

Field.Display: Volume has been destroyed.
